Posts.Content: On May 01, 2014 2:28 PM Sandy0104 wrote: May I suggest a relaxation technique that's gotten me through both BC and afib?  It's especially helpful when your mind is consumed with thoughts of "what if."  Meditation has been a lifesaver for me.  Rather than try and teach the technique, someone new would be helped by an audio assist.  There is a website,www.healthjourneys.com , and I'm recommending Bellruth Naperstak's cd's/mp3 recordings.  They walk you through relaxation and, more importantly, give you something to concentrate on beyond your procedures and the fright that comes with not knowing what lies ahead.  Hoping for good blessings, Sandy  Thank you Sandy for all the helpful tips and insight.  I hope you are doing well. I am new to this site and newly diagnosed with BC.  I am trying to find out all the info I can, especially from others who have already travelled down the road. Thank you for the link to healthjourneys.com .  I have already downloaded one relaxation recording.  I know your responses were over a year ago, so I'm not sure if you even come back to this site.  Nonetheless, I wanted to thank you and wish you well.  Take Care.   Sharon :)
